channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The UN mission appeals to the Taliban to restore internet access in Afghanistan
item.description: The outage was the first nationwide shutdown since the Taliban returned to power in August 2021 and was part of their professed crackdown on immorality.
item.content:encoded:
The outage was the first nationwide shutdown since the Taliban returned to power in August 2021 and was part of their professed crackdown on immorality.

(Image credit: Rahmat Gul/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: With therapy hard to get, people lean on AI for mental health. What are the risks?
item.description: People are using ChatGPT and other artificial intelligence apps to help them with emotional issues, but experts say they are not a substitute for therapy or companionship.
item.content:encoded: People are using ChatGPT and other artificial intelligence apps to help them with emotional issues, but experts say they are not a substitute for therapy or companionship.
item.dc:creator: Windsor Johnston

item.title: Government shuts down tonight barring a deal. And, U.S. military leaders gather in VA
item.description: Federal agencies are at risk of running out of funding tonight if Congress does not reach an agreement. And, hundreds of U.S. generals and admirals are gathering for a rare meeting with Trump today.
item.content:encoded:
Federal agencies are at risk of running out of funding tonight if Congress does not reach an agreement. And, hundreds of U.S. generals and admirals are gathering for a rare meeting with Trump today.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Germany thrived in the first China Shock. But the next one could prove catastrophic.
item.description: The export-led industrial model that Germany has pursued for decades is now at a crossroads.
item.content:encoded: The export-led industrial model that Germany has pursued for decades is now at a crossroads.
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Memphis and Portland, Ore. brace for troops. Why Chicago might be next
item.description: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker said the Department of Homeland Security has requested for 100 military personnel to help protect ICE agents and facilities in his state.
item.content:encoded:
Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker said the Department of Homeland Security has requested for 100 military personnel to help protect ICE agents and facilities in his state.

(Image credit: Mathieu Lewis-Rolland)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: 5 takeaways from the U.S. ceasefire proposal for Israel and Hamas
item.description: The leaders of the U.S. and Israel say they have agreed to a broad plan that could end Israel's war in Gaza. But substantial uncertainties remain.
item.content:encoded:
The leaders of the U.S. and Israel say they have agreed to a broad plan that could end Israel's war in Gaza. But substantial uncertainties remain.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Here's what a government shutdown could affect around the country
item.description: A federal shutdown will impact people across the United States. NPR's network of member stations explains how these effects will be felt nationwide.
item.content:encoded:
A federal shutdown will impact people across the United States. NPR's network of member stations explains how these effects will be felt nationwide.

(Image credit: Julio Cortez)
item.dc:creator: Caitlyn Kim

item.title: EV sales surge in the U.S. ahead of Sept. 30 tax credit deadline
item.description: A $7,500 tax credit is available for the lease or purchase of many electric vehicles — but only if contracts are inked by midnight on Sept. 30. The result: The market for EVs is a little distorted.
item.content:encoded:
A $7,500 tax credit is available for the lease or purchase of many electric vehicles — but only if contracts are inked by midnight on Sept. 30. The result: The market for EVs is a little distorted.

(Image credit: Charles Krupa)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: As sports betting explodes, should states set more limits to stop gambling addiction?
item.description: With concerns about addiction rising, some advocates and lawmakers call for federal regulations on the gambling industry — but would settle for more state laws to help curb excessive betting.
item.content:encoded:
With concerns about addiction rising, some advocates and lawmakers call for federal regulations on the gambling industry — but would settle for more state laws to help curb excessive betting.

(Image credit: Karen Brown)
item.dc:creator: Karen Brown

item.title: With no guarantee of U.S. weapons, Ukraine races to make its own
item.description: President Trump is sounding more supportive of Ukraine. But he still isn't pledging military aid for the country. As a result, Ukraine is producing as many of its own weapons as it can.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is sounding more supportive of Ukraine. But he still isn't pledging military aid for the country. As a result, Ukraine is producing as many of its own weapons as it can.

(Image credit: Greg Myre)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre
